metadata.title: CVE-2019-12521 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in Squid through 4.7. When Squid is parsing ESI, it keeps the ESI elements in ESIContext. ESIContext contains a buffer for holding a stack of ESIElements. When a new ESIElement is parsed, it is added via addStackElement. addStackElement has a check for the number of elements in this buffer, but it's off by 1, leading to a Heap Overflow of 1 element. The overflow is within the same structure so it can't affect adjacent memory blocks, and thus just leads to a crash while processing.

criterions.comment: squid package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.10-1ubuntu2').
